questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: How was Lindsay and Gretchen's problem resolved? (Story about twins wanting different pets)
options: A. One received her preferred pet; the other was disappointed
B. Pet store employee helped them decide
C. They decided on a pet together

content_zh.stem: How was Lindsay and Gretchen's problem resolved? (Story about twins wanting different pets)
options: A. One received her preferred pet; the other was disappointed
B. Pet store employee helped them decide
C. They decided on a pet together

questions.explanation_en: The narrative states they worked out their differences and decided together which pet to take, selecting a rabbit they both agreed upon.
questions.explanation_zh: The narrative states they worked out their differences and decided together which pet to take, selecting a rabbit they both agreed upon.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-001 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: The friendly neighbors live two floors above our apartment. Which set of words all mean the opposite of the preposition 'above'?

content_zh.stem: The friendly neighbors live two floors above our apartment. Which set of words all mean the opposite of the preposition 'above'?

questions.explanation_en: All three words in option C (beneath, under, below) denote position lower than something, making them true opposites of 'above'.
questions.explanation_zh: All three words in option C (beneath, under, below) denote position lower than something, making them true opposites of 'above'.

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Darling, please go to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me. Which words complete the sentence correctly?

content_zh.stem: Darling, please go to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me. Which words complete the sentence correctly?

questions.explanation_en: The phrase 'a few' requires plural forms for both the container and contents: 'cans of beans'.
questions.explanation_zh: The phrase 'a few' requires plural forms for both the container and contents: 'cans of beans'.

content_en.stem: Which version moves the word 'darling' to the most suitable spot in the sentence: 'Darling, please go to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me.'
options: A. Please go to the pantry, darling, and grab a few ________ for me
B. Please go, darling, to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me
C. Please go to the pantry and grab, darling, a few ________ for me

content_zh.stem: Which version moves the word 'darling' to the most suitable spot in the sentence: 'Darling, please go to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me.'
options: A. Please go to the pantry, darling, and grab a few ________ for me
B. Please go, darling, to the pantry and grab a few ________ for me
C. Please go to the pantry and grab, darling, a few ________ for me

questions.explanation_en: Placing 'darling' between two complete clauses maintains natural sentence flow without interrupting individual thoughts.
questions.explanation_zh: Placing 'darling' between two complete clauses maintains natural sentence flow without interrupting individual thoughts.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-003 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Suppose you are asked to write a school essay titled 'Why I Like Going to the Museum.' Which details support the topic of the essay? (Select two)
options: A. At the museum, you can learn about interesting things
B. The museum has a gift shop with cool T-shirts
C. Walking from hall to hall in the museum can be tiring
D. You must remember to keep quiet at the museum
E. Some museum exhibits can be boring

content_zh.stem: Suppose you are asked to write a school essay titled 'Why I Like Going to the Museum.' Which details support the topic of the essay? (Select two)
options: A. At the museum, you can learn about interesting things
B. The museum has a gift shop with cool T-shirts
C. Walking from hall to hall in the museum can be tiring
D. You must remember to keep quiet at the museum
E. Some museum exhibits can be boring

questions.explanation_en: Only options containing positive language ('interesting', 'cool') support an essay about enjoying museum visits.
questions.explanation_zh: Only options containing positive language ('interesting', 'cool') support an essay about enjoying museum visits.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-004 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the passage: Bees are very important. They fly from flower to flower. They carry pollen on their legs. This helps flowers grow into fruits and vegetables. Without bees, we would not have many of the foods we eat. What is the main idea of this passage?
options: B. Bees are important because they help food grow

content_zh.stem: Read the passage: Bees are very important. They fly from flower to flower. They carry pollen on their legs. This helps flowers grow into fruits and vegetables. Without bees, we would not have many of the foods we eat. What is the main idea of this passage?
options: B. Bees are important because they help food grow

questions.explanation_en: The passage explains how bees help food grow by carrying pollen. The main idea is that bees are important for food production.
questions.explanation_zh: The passage explains how bees help food grow by carrying pollen. The main idea is that bees are important for food production.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the passage: Ben wanted to build a birdhouse. First, he gathered wood and nails. Next, he hammered the pieces together. Then, he painted it blue. Last, he hung it on a tree. What did Ben do right before hanging the birdhouse?

content_zh.stem: Read the passage: Ben wanted to build a birdhouse. First, he gathered wood and nails. Next, he hammered the pieces together. Then, he painted it blue. Last, he hung it on a tree. What did Ben do right before hanging the birdhouse?

questions.explanation_en: The passage lists the steps in order. Right before hanging the birdhouse on a tree, Ben painted it blue.
questions.explanation_zh: The passage lists the steps in order. Right before hanging the birdhouse on a tree, Ben painted it blue.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the passage: Kai's family went to the beach. Kai built a big sandcastle. Then a wave washed it away. Kai sat down and put his head in his hands. How did Kai most likely feel when the wave washed away his sandcastle?

content_zh.stem: Read the passage: Kai's family went to the beach. Kai built a big sandcastle. Then a wave washed it away. Kai sat down and put his head in his hands. How did Kai most likely feel when the wave washed away his sandcastle?

questions.explanation_en: Kai sat down and put his head in his hands after his sandcastle was destroyed. This shows he felt sad.
questions.explanation_zh: Kai sat down and put his head in his hands after his sandcastle was destroyed. This shows he felt sad.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the sentence: The enormous elephant walked slowly through the forest. What does 'enormous' mean?

content_zh.stem: Read the sentence: The enormous elephant walked slowly through the forest. What does 'enormous' mean?

questions.explanation_en: Enormous means very large or very big. Elephants are known for being very large animals.
questions.explanation_zh: Enormous means very large or very big. Elephants are known for being very large animals.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-105 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the passage: Leo watched a big rocket launch on TV with his dad. The rocket made a loud roar and shot up into the sky with bright flames. Leo jumped up and shouted, 'I want to be an astronaut!' Why did Leo want to be an astronaut?
options: A. His dad told him to be one
B. He was excited by seeing the rocket launch
C. He was scared of the loud noise
D. He wanted to watch more TV

content_zh.stem: Read the passage: Leo watched a big rocket launch on TV with his dad. The rocket made a loud roar and shot up into the sky with bright flames. Leo jumped up and shouted, 'I want to be an astronaut!' Why did Leo want to be an astronaut?
options: A. His dad told him to be one
B. He was excited by seeing the rocket launch
C. He was scared of the loud noise
D. He wanted to watch more TV

questions.explanation_en: Seeing the exciting rocket launch inspired Leo. He jumped up and shouted with excitement, showing the launch caused his dream.
questions.explanation_zh: Seeing the exciting rocket launch inspired Leo. He jumped up and shouted with excitement, showing the launch caused his dream.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-106 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which sentence is an opinion?
options: B. Cats are the best pets ever.
D. Cats can see in the dark.

content_zh.stem: Which sentence is an opinion?
options: B. Cats are the best pets ever.
D. Cats can see in the dark.

questions.explanation_en: An opinion is what someone believes or feels. 'Cats are the best pets ever' is a personal feeling, not a fact that can be proven.
questions.explanation_zh: An opinion is what someone believes or feels. 'Cats are the best pets ever' is a personal feeling, not a fact that can be proven.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Read the passage: Ava looked at the dark clouds in the sky. She grabbed her raincoat and umbrella before leaving the house. What will most likely happen next?
options: A. It will be a sunny day
D. Ava will stay home all day

content_zh.stem: Read the passage: Ava looked at the dark clouds in the sky. She grabbed her raincoat and umbrella before leaving the house. What will most likely happen next?
options: A. It will be a sunny day
D. Ava will stay home all day

questions.explanation_en: Dark clouds and bringing a raincoat and umbrella are clues that rain is coming. Ava prepared for rain.
questions.explanation_zh: Dark clouds and bringing a raincoat and umbrella are clues that rain is coming. Ava prepared for rain.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-READ-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which word in the sentence is a proper noun? 'My dog Max loves to play in the park.'

content_zh.stem: Which word in the sentence is a proper noun? 'My dog Max loves to play in the park.'

questions.explanation_en: A proper noun names a specific person, place, or thing and is capitalized. 'Max' is a specific name for the dog.
questions.explanation_zh: A proper noun names a specific person, place, or thing and is capitalized. 'Max' is a specific name for the dog.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

content_en.stem: Choose the correct verb: 'Yesterday, we _______ to the library.'

content_zh.stem: Choose the correct verb: 'Yesterday, we _______ to the library.'

questions.explanation_en: The word 'yesterday' tells us the action happened in the past, so we use the past tense verb 'walked'.
questions.explanation_zh: The word 'yesterday' tells us the action happened in the past, so we use the past tense verb 'walked'.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which word is an adjective in this sentence? 'The tiny kitten climbed the tall tree.'

content_zh.stem: Which word is an adjective in this sentence? 'The tiny kitten climbed the tall tree.'

questions.explanation_en: An adjective describes a noun. 'Tiny' describes what kind of kitten it is. ('Tall' is also an adjective, but 'tiny' is the listed answer.)
questions.explanation_zh: An adjective describes a noun. 'Tiny' describes what kind of kitten it is. ('Tall' is also an adjective, but 'tiny' is the listed answer.)
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

content_en.stem: Which sentence uses the correct end punctuation?

content_zh.stem: Which sentence uses the correct end punctuation?

questions.explanation_zh: Questions that ask for information end with a question mark. 'Where is my backpack' is asking a question.

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: What is the correct plural of 'mouse'?

content_zh.stem: What is the correct plural of 'mouse'?

questions.explanation_en: 'Mouse' has an irregular plural form. Instead of adding -s or -es, it changes to 'mice'.
questions.explanation_zh: 'Mouse' has an irregular plural form. Instead of adding -s or -es, it changes to 'mice'.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-105 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which sentence has correct capitalization?
options: A. we went to the Store on monday.
B. We went to the store on Monday.
C. we went to the Store on Monday.
D. We Went To The Store On Monday.

content_zh.stem: Which sentence has correct capitalization?
options: A. we went to the Store on monday.
B. We went to the store on Monday.
C. we went to the Store on Monday.
D. We Went To The Store On Monday.

questions.explanation_en: Capitalize the first word of a sentence and proper nouns. Days of the week like 'Monday' are always capitalized. 'Store' is not a proper noun here.
questions.explanation_zh: Capitalize the first word of a sentence and proper nouns. Days of the week like 'Monday' are always capitalized. 'Store' is not a proper noun here.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-106 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which of these is a complete sentence?
options: C. She likes to read books.

content_zh.stem: Which of these is a complete sentence?
options: C. She likes to read books.

questions.explanation_en: A complete sentence needs a subject and a verb and expresses a complete thought. 'She likes to read books' has a subject (she), a verb (likes), and tells a complete idea.
questions.explanation_zh: A complete sentence needs a subject and a verb and expresses a complete thought. 'She likes to read books' has a subject (she), a verb (likes), and tells a complete idea.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: english

content_en.stem: Which sentence uses commas correctly in a list?
options: A. I packed apples oranges and grapes.
B. I packed apples, oranges, and grapes.
C. I packed, apples oranges, and grapes.
D. I packed apples oranges, and, grapes.

content_zh.stem: Which sentence uses commas correctly in a list?
options: A. I packed apples oranges and grapes.
B. I packed apples, oranges, and grapes.
C. I packed, apples oranges, and grapes.
D. I packed apples oranges, and, grapes.

questions.explanation_en: When listing three or more items, place a comma after each item except the last. A comma before 'and' (the Oxford comma) keeps the list clear.
questions.explanation_zh: When listing three or more items, place a comma after each item except the last. A comma before 'and' (the Oxford comma) keeps the list clear.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G2-LANG-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
